      • token

        public Token token(Token.Type type)

      • isEol

        public boolean isEol()
        Is used to check if current() is a linebreak. The scan()-method uses the method to check if it should return a eol-token
        Returns:
        true if linebreak, else false

      • isEof

        public boolean isEof()
        Checks if currentChar is EOF
        Returns:
        true if currenChar is EOF. Otherwise false

      • isWhitespace

        public boolean isWhitespace()
        Checks for whitespace.
        Returns:
        true if it is whitespace. Otherwise false

      • isDigit

        public boolean isDigit()
        Checks if current() is a digit

      • isOperator

        public boolean isOperator()
        Checks if current() is an operator "!&*+-=>

      • isUppercase

        public boolean isUppercase()
        Checks if current() is an uppercase letter

      • isLowercase

        public boolean isLowercase()
        Checks if current() is a lowercase letter

      • isAnycase

        public boolean isAnycase()
        Checks if current() is a letter

      • scanKeyword

        public Token scanKeyword()
                  throws ScannerError
        Is called from the Scan()-method. Tries to match the current str to a keyword
        Throws:
        ScannerError - the length of the string is less than 1.

      • scanUppercase

        public Token scanUppercase()
                    throws ScannerError
        Is called from the Scan()-method. Tries to assign the token t to a type-token or a coordinat-token.
        Throws:
        ScannerError - if t consists of lowercase letters followed by digits.

      • scanVar

        public Token scanVar()
              throws ScannerError
        Is called from the scan()-method. Tries to assign the token t to a variable-token
        Returns:
        a variable-token if t consists of a $ followed by a number of anycase letters.
        Throws:
        ScannerError - if the length of t is less than 0.

      • scanOperator

        public Token scanOperator()
                   throws ScannerError
        Is called from the scan()-method. Tries to match the String str to a operator token.
        Throws:
        ScannerError - if the str doesn't match a valid operator

      • scanNumeric

        public Token scanNumeric()
        Is called from the scan()-method. Tries to assign the token t to an Int literal token

      • scanString

        public Token scanString()
                 throws ScannerError
        Is called from the scan()-method. Tries to assign the token t to a String literal token
        Throws:
        ScannerError - if t doesn't end with a '"'

      • scan

        public Token scan()
           throws ScannerError
        The main scan()-method, which picks the appropriate sub scan-method, depending on which symbol is currently looked at. Is called in the main()-method.
        Throws:
        ScannerError - if the current symbol isn't a valid one

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
